object: Carl Bosch (German pronunciation: [kaʁl ˈbɔʃ]; 27 August 1874 – 26 April 1940) was a German chemist and engineer and Nobel Laureate in Chemistry. He was a pioneer in the field of high-pressure industrial chemistry and founder of IG Farben, at one point the world's largest chemical company.
recognition of their contributions to the invention and development of chemical high pressure methods

Carl Bosch (German pronunciation: [kaʁl ˈbɔʃ]; 27 August 1874 – 26 April 1940) was a German chemist and engineer and Nobel Laureate in Chemistry. He was a pioneer in the field of high-pressure industrial chemistry and founder of IG Farben, at one point the world's largest chemical company.
